intro: Rytigynia verruculosa, commonly known as the roughleaf rytigynia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Rytigyniaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, rough-textured leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
